content.description: A nice line of pockets heading up the left side of the face, but not up the arete, which is V3. Any beta I tried that eventally led me to the obvious "thermometer" hold seemed V4ish. Not as good as Arise and Shine, but still a fun line.
content.location: Start seated on the corner of the "base" of the boulder, probably with a left hand in a fingerlock. Establish on the two obvious pockets, then head up to the thermometer and top out.

content.description: Bust a couple tough intro moves on crimps and pockets, set up, and bust a big move for the lip. Easy topout.
content.protection: 1-2 pads, a spotter wouldn't be bad for those who chose to jump.
content.location: Start seated under the roof on the right, and finish straight up through an obvious jug. If you aren't slightly worried about dabbing the neighboring boulder you probably are on the V4.

content.description: Nice, secluded area with some really good rock. Most of the problems are low-angle VB slabs, but there is one nice hanging boulder with a few harder lines on it. The pin is for the parking, not the boulder itself.
